title: What is IT Asset Management and why is it important? - Quora

response.answer_text: IT asset management is the process of managing, monitoring, and tracking IT (Information and Technology) assets. Some people also refer to it as ITAM. When it needs an asset needs up-gradation, when it needs to be disposed of, either each asset accounted or not! These activities also fall under IT asset management. Now you must be thinking, “what is IT assets?” The answer is simple their hardware such as laptops, computers, servers, and software. Software is very important because they have validity if the software is found which is not valid anymore then the company will be paying a huge amount of penalty. So, this is where IT asset management comes into play, it sends alert and notification about the software to the manager. They can renew the software and avoid penalties. The benefits of asset management keep track of assets and lets you know the exact whereabouts of an asset. It also lets you know who is using it and when it will be returned. To maximize the value of the asset they need to be maintained so that any asset failure does not occur. With this software, you can manage maintenance as well that too proactively. Managing the asset life cycle is a very crucial part of IT asset management.

IT Asset Management (ITAM) is the procedure which helps in maintaining and developing the policies, standards, systems, processes which assist any organization to appropriately manage their IT Asset concerning costs, control, risk and any other type of compliance. Besides this, it also helps in evaluating the life cycle of each asset and aids in formulating strategic decisions which would prove to be fruitful for accomplishing the goals of the organization. IT Asset Management has numerous benefits in an organization. Some of the major ones are: 1) Identifying obsolete asset(s) An obsolete asset in any organization is a bane and hampers the overall working of any company. ITAM helps in identifying those assets which then should be replaced or upgraded to increase the efficiency of the organization. 2) Tracking & monitoring the asset(s) It also assists in keeping a track of all the incoming assets; their life cycle and the efficiency. This, in turn, gives the knowledge to the owners when it would be safe to upgrade the asset which would ultimately increase productivity. 3) Proper disposal of an asset(s) All the outgoing assets need proper disposal. If an asset is disposed off with any sensitive information on it then it will lead to a breach inthe security of the company.
